Michigan Ongoing Health & Safety Training Refresher 2023
Section 3: Prevention & Control of Infectious Disease (Including Immunizations)

Licensing Rules Regarding Immunizations 

Let’s take a look at the requirements for family and group child care homes regarding children’s immunizations. This information falls under Michigan Licensing Rule 400.1907.

The rule requires that a child’s health records include documentation that immunizations and boosters:

  1. Have been completed OR

  2. Are in progress OR

  3. Are not being administered due to the child being under two months, or parents have a religious or a medical reason.

  4. Any waiver for children not being immunized must be signed by the parent or child’s physician.

  5. The required vaccinations are those recommended by the State Department of Health and Human Services.

The state of Michigan follows the Center for Disease Control recommendations. The link to the CDC vaccine schedule can be found in the Support Material at the end of this section.

Child Care Center Licensing Rule

Now we will look at the rules for licensed child care centers. This information falls under Michigan Licensing Rule 400.8143 for Center based child care sites regarding the Child’s Record. The required vaccinations are those recommended by the State Department of Health and Human Services.

The licensing rule requires that a child’s health records include documentation on immunizations and boosters. This documentation includes:

  • Certificate of Immunizations with minimum of one dose

    A certificate of immunization that must show that a minimum of one dose of each immunizing agent has been given.

  • A copy of waiver addressed to DHHS if not immunized

    Waivers must be addressed to the Michigan Department of Health and Human Services, and signed by the parent, stating that immunizations are not being administered due to a religious or medical reason.

  • Updated Certificate at 4 months to show that delayed immunizations are now caught up

    When a child under school-age, whose immunizations were not up-to-date at the time of enrollment has been in attendance for 4 months, an updated certificate showing completion of all additional immunization requirements as specified by DHHS must be kept on file, unless there is a signed statement by a licensed health care provider stating immunizations are in progress.

  • Report to DHHS by Oct. 1st, immunizations for all children enrolled

    The report due to the Michigan Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) must give the status of each enrolled child’s immunizations. In 2021 there were 76 violations issued due to immunization information not being in the child’s chart.

As stated before the link to the CDC vaccine schedule that Michigan follows can be found in the Support Material at the end of this section.
